urls.title: EA chief: UK climate impacts 'hitting worst case scenario'
urls.description: The impacts of the climate emergency in the UK are hitting "worst case scenario" levels, threatening to kill more people than Covid-19 and "most wars" and "destroy the basis of the modern economy and modern society", the head of the Environment Agency (EA) has warned.

urls.title: Extinction: Freshwater fish in 'catastrophic' decline
urls.description: Numbers are plunging due to pollution, unsustainable fishing and the draining of rivers.

tweets.text:
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency And 24 hours ago the Beeb was reporting this:

"Extinction: Freshwater fish in 'catastrophic' decline - BBC News" https://t.co/laXvdJ1KBB

tweets.text: "The net effects (of climate inaction) will collapse ecosystems, slash crop yields, take out the infrastructure that our civilisation depends on, and destroy the basis of the modern economy and modern society", warns @EnvAgency in a burst of brutal honesty.

With yet another local authority signing up enhance and protect Staffordshire‚Äôs #NatureRecoveryNetwork we edge closer to full countywide adoption. @CraigBennett3 @StaffsWildlife @NE_WestMids @EnvAgencyMids @WildlifeTrusts https://t.co/9cwjev7DYG

Day Nine.
The pollution is STILL emanating from Furness Vale Marina, stretching over a mile to New Mills. The boom at Bridge 29 isn't working and the polluting waste oil is just as bad as it was a week ago. Why is the slick still not being stopped at Bridge 30? @CanalRiverTrust https://t.co/9lxlWtbhQe

urls.title: UK‚Äôs worst case scenario climate crisis incidents are ‚Äòalready happening‚Äô | The Big Issue
urls.description: The climate crisis will "destroy the basis of modern society" if left unchecked, the Environment Agency's chief executive warned

tweets.text: The climate crisis will "destroy modern society" if those in power don't take decisive action now, the @EnvAgency warned  https://t.co/gARe7u0yu4

tweets.text: @RachSalv @thameswater It may be more noticeable than usual because the water isn‚Äôt being flushed through the lock as often, due to lack of boat traffic during lockdown. However, the lock teams do open up the locks once a day to help flush this build-up through. Hope that puts your mind at ease. Jess

tweets.text:
Today we have published our Regulating for People, the Environment and Growth report.

It shows the importance of regulation in allowing industry to thrive while protecting air, land and water. 

Read the full report here - https://t.co/qDmR5R6ZSy https://t.co/jvZwAb1Vd7

urls.title: BUILDING WITH NATURE STANDARDS BOARD ‚Äî Building with Nature
urls.description: 26 March 2019, updated 27 April 2020 Building with Nature is delighted to announce the appointment of the organisation‚Äôs Standards Board. Eleven additional members join the Chair, Professor Alister Scott, and will act as the guardian body for the Building with Nature standards.
